website_summaries.verdict: If you're low on space, consider this tree, which is designed to fit in the corner.
pros: Triangular, pyramid style design is built for stability and fits in the corner to save space
Holds a reasonable amount of plates
cons: If you are having trouble assembling, tighten the bolts just enough to keep it together as you go
Then tighten when all the pieces are on

customer_reviews.title: my olympic 45 and 35 fit on same side
customer_reviews.text: i see a lot of questions asking if olympic plates fit. i have fitness gear olympic plates (not bumper) and you can see they fit perfectly. some other brand plates are different sizes, but the ones i have fit well. i have around 500 lbs on this rack and it holds it perfect. i even put my EZ bar in the middle like another reviewer suggested. awesome rack. also, assembly took me 10 mins...super easy.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Great weight tree and great value. I have about 200lbs. on it. Also, instead of placing the cup holder at the top of the tree, I drilled a hole in the center plate at the bottom and bolted the cup holder there. Now I have an EZ bar holder too! Just slide the bar down through the top hole and the cup holder keeps the bar from sliding out.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Gearhart

customer_reviews.title: Solid and hold a lot of weights
customer_reviews.text: Because of the pyramidal construction, be patient and assemble it loose all around, then tighten as things get lined up, otherwise you'll have a mess! Super solid and the spacing allows for all sizes of 1" weight plates. It will also hold olympic plates, but the larger ones may not fit, as they will sag on the 1" bars and impede fitment of multiple sizes on one side. Happy lifting!
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: A little wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Decent price. But I think 300lbs. is a but of a stretch. Maybe if they added some additional reinforcement half way up but I can already see the bar beginning to bow which makes me think it’ll inevitably collapse. I doubt they do any special heat treatment to make is intentionally springy. I’d go 50lbs. under max for safety factor.
customer_reviews.author: Tolderius

customer_reviews.title: and 25 pound plates (1" standard) totaling 310 lbs and it holds them easily with room for growth
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's a simple piece of equipment and does exactly what it's supposed to - sits there and holds up my weights. I have a combination of 2 1/2, 5, 10, and 25 pound plates (1" standard) totaling 310 lbs and it holds them easily with room for growth. The rails flex slightly but no danger of failure. The only reason I didn't give it a 5th star is because it's a pain to assemble by yourself. Still definitely worth getting but if you can recruit a someone to help just by holding rails in place while lining up and tightening nuts and bolts it will make things MUCH easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roberts

customer_reviews.title: My weight are like leaves.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put together and holds lots of weight. Which is why I bought it. I have 2x45, 2x35, 2x25, 10x10, 10x5, and 2x2.5 on it. The plate tree isn't going any where but it feels like if I'm rough with it, the posts or the bolts might break at some point. Doubt they will though. It just doesn't feel as solid as some of the other plate trees I've used. But those were also $100+. But the plate tree met my expectations. It holds lots of weight. I did mount the plate tree on a home made dolly, like the other reviewer, so I can move it if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Great to organize your plates, assembly is annoying
customer_reviews.text: Bought this plate tree for my newly acquired plates for my home gym that im putting together. It definitely does its job, i have 435lbs of weight on it after it is fully assembled and it is strong. The biggest downside of this is the assembly. It’s kind of annoying because of the awkward placement of the bolts. Not to mention the threading of the screws aren’t well done so it was a workout in itself tighening things up. But overall it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronito Rivero

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product.  Could not Assemble.  Company Did Not Help
customer_reviews.text: The nuts and bolts on my weight rack were the wrong size. They didn't fit. So I tried substituting some own that I had lying around but they weren't the exact right size so the rack was wobbly. I contacted the company about the problem. They told me this was normal, and to use pliers to hold the bolts and nuts and really forcefully screw them. I tried that and it didn't work. Going to throw this junk away. Good bye $45 and few hours of time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rack, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My old weight rack my brother built for me in high school shop class was no longer cutting it so I began a search for a second rack. It was honestly a harder decision that I thought it would be, it seemed reviews were spotty on some and prices were too high on others. I'm glad I ran across this stand eventually. It's well built and very sturdy. Assembly was easy as well. I'm using the "standard size" for Olympic plates and it's working great. I can fit 45's all the way down to 2.5's on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have this thing loaded up with 300 lbs of weights and it handles them like a champ. Assembly was a breeze and it seems very well made. The cup holder on the top is convenient too. I didn't think I would use but I find myself using it daily otherwise I'm always forgetting where I set my glass down or I'm kicking it over (my gym is located in my garage)
customer_reviews.author: Claudicate

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for my small home gym
customer_reviews.text: I put it together in 5 minutes and it holds my weights perfectly. *you will need a 5/8 socket wrench or regular wrench to assemble, there is not one included
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very nice, easy to assemble. Cleaned up the weight room
customer_reviews.text: Hey All, I purchased this 1" standard weight rack from Amazon for $56 & free shipping(now it's a lot more). It was easy to assemble and use. I've had upwards of ~180 pounds on it with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: GK Northwest

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy works great
customer_reviews.text: Holds an entire Olympic weight set very sturdy, recommend assembly with at least 2 people alone was much harder than it had to be
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 6 45s, 2. 35s, 2 25s, 2 10s, nd 4 5s no problem, it wiggles you may think it’s gonna break, the wiggle is actually a good thing if you didn’t have that flex in the structure, it would surely snap, good design for the price. I should do this/give reviews for living, lol I'm too honest though.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble And Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to assemble and much cheaper than if I had my husband try to make me something similar. As you can see from the photo, I did not use the cup insert in the top (thinking of attaching it to the bottom center piece like one reviewer but, for your information, the cup itself is the only plastic piece). The second picture is how I used to store my weight plates. Marcy has not disappointed me yet!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Nolen

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Finally got my plate holder after waiting for weeks. With my wife’s help, took about 45 minutes. Pretty sturdy, I even put some of my Olympic plates on it. May order another one as my garage gym expands and I can get my hands on more plates.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Shore

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RACK FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: First off, assembly was not too hard, I was able to do it on my own but having 2 people would make it easier (keep in mind you do need your own tools). Yes the Rack is a bit wobbly BUT it feels solid and pretty sturdy. So far I have about 220 pounds on my rack but if you read other reviews, there are people who have A LOT more on theirs with larger Olympic plates. If you remove the cup holder you can use it told hold your bars, I currently have my rack holding a 6ft standard bar and an Olympic EZ bar. I purchased this rack for $53 and it was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Works well for its intended purpose. Does not come with assembly tools, but is simple to put together. I have 210 lbs total on the rack and im not sure ide feel comfortable putting much more than that on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Good gear
customer_reviews.text: The comments I saw in the reviews that rated it poorly look to me like they need a decent wrench to put the thing together. My nuts and bolts fit together perfectly and fastened very tightly. But I used a socket wrench with a ratchet handle. It undoubtedly would have gone faster with a helper, but I had no real trouble. I did use a box wrench for the final tightening, as the socket wrench was a bit awkward as the nut tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was more difficult than expected. I thought I ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was more difficult than expected. I thought I couldn't tighten the aircraft nuts at first, but they went tightened with a pair of heavy duty pliers. It seems stable with over 250 pounds of weight and I put a barbell where the cup holder should be. The posts on this weight tree are not spaced far enough to hold my plates without overlapping; I managed to fit a set of Olympic weights on it but that leaves two unusable posts.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy even with a lot of weight on it
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy even with a lot of weight on it. I’ve had this for coming up on three years and it doesn’t wobble or feel weak even when it’s loaded with weight exactly what you’re looking for for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I use 300+ lbs of weight on this rack and it seems pretty solid. I do not have a use for the cup holder, but you can remove that piece and possibly use the hole in the top of the structure to hold 1 or 2 curl bars depending on the diameter of ends.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Branham

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my bumper plate set!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Olympic set of bumper plate weights. 2 x 45, 2 x 25, 4 x 10, 2 x 5, 2 x 2.5. They were able to fit on the tree and it is actually very stable. Great price. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Slight wobble, but still a great organizer
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was straightforward and all the parts were included. There's no center support apart from the base and apex of the tree, so the arms will wobble if you don't return your plates gently. It still stays flush with the floor though, so there's no concern that it will tip over. I've also found it useful to try and balance the weight on each side of the tree to reduce the wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product is a nightmare to assemble they made it so difficult to be able to tighten the bolts makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Sevah

customer_reviews.title: Extremely unstable.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to put together aside from the extremely tight screws, but with only 150 lbs pretty evenly distributed, this thing is LITERALLY wobbling when I take a weight off or put one on. Doesn't inspire any confidence. Seemed sturdy until I put some 25s and 50s on it. Hopefully this design is improved upon, but unless you just need a storage spot for super light peanut weights, in the meantime, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, no doubt it'll hold plenty of weight but can be prone to tipping over if weights arent evenly stacked on it and it gets bumped or pushed - so just be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: VERY sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This was very sturdy once assembled. I did find some of the bolts hard to adjust - I had to find a wrench that fit perfect to get them tightened. Once I got it put together I was very impressed with the heavy duty feeling of the "tree" Overall I recommend :)
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good product ! Going to purchase again !
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and does the job. I loaded 450 lbs on it for a test. It did hold but it bent. It’s rated less. So it’s a 10/10 for me !
customer_reviews.author: Ely and Juan

customer_reviews.title: Strong and holds olympic weights also!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome weight rack! It’s built pretty strong and even holds olympic size weights. Fast shipping and easy assembly. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: J.D

customer_reviews.title: Great weight tree
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my fitness gear weight plates. Have 260 lbs on it with room to spare. Compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: RK2014

customer_reviews.title: Must have for home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great product really cleaned up my garage gym by organizing all my plates holds a lot more than you would think mine is holding about 550lbs of plates and is very sturdy great purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Cheap,  sturdy,  simple
customer_reviews.text: It's a little floppy when you move it around, but once you have it in place and loaded with weight it stays in place and remains sturdy. I like it, it's a good product for cheap $$
customer_reviews.author: Derek DiMeglio

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Sturdy and holds all our weights. Very good purchase especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S Price

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this purchase but it is really strong and unassuming in my workout room. Works great and relatively easy to put together. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Zumbot

customer_reviews.title: It’s not a bad weight tree once assembled
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a bad weight tree once assembled, but the nuts they included were capped in such a way that they could only screw on so far, leaving a good half-inch of room for the bolt to move around, meaning I had to buy the right ones myself. Not a terribly expensive thing, but it was annoying that this wasn’t foreseen by the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... LesMills on Demand classes (like BodyPump) - so much better than going to the gym to do the classes
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy-I currently have it holding 2 weight sets (plus a couple of extras) for my LesMills on Demand classes (like BodyPump) - so much better than going to the gym to do the classes. I have 6 tens, 6 fives, and 4 two pound weights on this thing and no problem-I just make sure to always try to keep the sides about equal when removing/replacing the weights.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a young lady and I put this together all by myself it is very sturdy and was perfect for my son. Definitely keeps the weights organized.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C.

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. Did need some assistance due to shape of some of the pieces. But, overall worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. Dacpano

customer_reviews.title: Worth it must have
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend to anyone I put way over the weight it exceeds and that stand is a champ worth the money a must buy
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and wasn't really that hard to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed to clean up my home gym. I had piles of weights on the floor and I'm a neat freak and it was eating at me. I finally broke down and ordered this and couldn't be happier. I put all my weights, clips, and shackles on this thing. It doesn't wobble, it doesn't lean. It just does it's job and sits in the corner of the room looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, but not as wide as described
customer_reviews.text: Seems very sturdy. It took me about an hour to put together using a 5/8 inch gear wrench. The dimensions in the description are significantly off. The distance between each leg is 22 inches, not 30 inches. One of the base frames was shorter than the other two. I’m not hanging huge plates on it, so this works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Christ

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: It flexes quite a bit when putting weight in it, but it does seem sturdy and I have no complaints after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not strong
customer_reviews.text: Product can not hold high weight. It flexes too much.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works good, assembly is a snap
customer_reviews.text: There's not too much to review here. It's constructed sturdily enough and assembles quickly. There's 8 pieces if I remember correctly. It all goes together with large nuts and bolts. Held all the weight I piled on to it, and I must say that not having all the plates lying all over the place really made a nice impact on the look of my home gym. Price was right, product arrived in a timely fashion, so I'd recommend it to anyone. Only reason I didn't 5/5 it is because it could have used thicker gauge steel, but really it works just fine as is.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L.

customer_reviews.title: Possible fake reviews - this product is very cheap
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at the reviews that call this stand sturdy. It literally wobbles and moves as you place heavier (35-45lbs) plates. It's incredibly cheaply made and do not recommend it at all. The metal bearings wobble like plastic when you load weights.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: nothing to complain about it. Have about 290 lbs on it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight rack, fair price. 15 minutes to assemble. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Abbatello

customer_reviews.title: Leaves all my weight sizes at hand without having to move other sizes out of the way.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The material flexes a little when I move it or put 75 lb or 50 lb plates on it (while loading it, it doesn't look bent while sitting static). I like that it has 8 places to store weights so that all my weights have their own posts: around the bottom: 75, 50, 25; middle tier: 10, 6; around the top: 5, 2.5, 1.25. And it has a cup holder for my water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: losmurfs

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda wobble but it was okay...not the best one but does the job. The shipping was very quick.
customer_reviews.author: Boric

customer_reviews.title: Yep
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my misc. weights and it does a great job. Though when I mix some of the olympic sized with the standard, clearances between the different tiers get a little small. But that's beyond its design. It's sturdy and only took about 10 or 15 minutes to get completely setup and used. Only major drawback is in its one convenience feature. The cup holder is far too small for most waterbottles or large cups that you would be using to hold your protein drink or other supplement.
customer_reviews.author: Tnadz

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy, low space requirement
customer_reviews.text: A good piece of gear that worked out perfectly for me. I needed a weight holder that didn't take up a lot of space, yet can I can hang over 300 pounds of plates on. This plate tree fit the bill. One star off because it was hard to put together, but once it's completed, it is extremely sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: pinto4402

customer_reviews.title: good tree
customer_reviews.text: This tree is pretty decent. The flat sections of metal wobble a little but it's quite sturdy. It holds olympic and 1" plates, i'm not too concerned it will tip over if overweighted on one side. I was hoping bumper plates would fit on this but those things are so huge the tree can only hold 2. Definitely dig the cup holder. Assembly was decent, it pays to have a socket set and a ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: shog

customer_reviews.title: Ask a Friend for Help
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy after put together and great for the price but an ABSOLUTE nightmare to assembly for one person. Rails are awkward and to heavy to hold secure with one hand while tightening nuts. Took me two hours by myself. A socket wrench is a must to put this together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to assemble and no tools. If I could give a minus, for assembling, it would be a -30.
customer_reviews.author: David Holland

customer_reviews.title: takes a while to get align and tighten properly
customer_reviews.text: but quite sturdy once assembled properly i used em for both the standards and the olympic plates, holding up quite well
customer_reviews.author: kemico

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with how sturdy this was, and easy to put together! Fits perfectly I my gym, and makes it less cluttered with weights laying up against walls where we can step on them.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Good weight holder
customer_reviews.text: I use this to store about 230 lbs in plates. The bars flex very slightly when putting on heavier weights, but it has held up just fine. It is also quite stable when loaded up unless you have all the weight on one side. I use the cup holder on top to hold my chalk bag. This stand is very light and easy to move when unloaded.
customer_reviews.author: M. Picotte

customer_reviews.title: Prefect
customer_reviews.text: You can save many discs, up to 45 pounds. for the price is perfect
customer_reviews.author: ycarazana

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my exercise room.
customer_reviews.text: This plate tree is simple, and very easy to put together. I needed something basic for my weight plates, and this is great!
customer_reviews.author: Traca91

customer_reviews.title: it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bumper plates dont fit well on this. However, it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Plate Tree
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home gym and use it for storage of 300lbs worth of plates. It is well made and sturdy under the weight and was quite easy to assemble, and has a very small footprint in the room so it does not take up much space. The cup holder on top is a nice little extra, mostly because of where I have the tree in my center. But I would have preferred a hole to store the bar instead. The bar won't quite fit when the cup holder is removed.
customer_reviews.author: KajunDC

customer_reviews.title: Clean up your workout space!!!
customer_reviews.text: An affordable way to pick those plates up off the floor
customer_reviews.author: paul k maguire

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of sturdy equipment... all the parts were included ! Safely holds all my weight plates off the floor even the 50#'ers.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have Olympic plates with 2 in wholes. I still love the rack even though it's meant for standard 1in
customer_reviews.author: Alex Winchel

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Putting together was a little tricky for one person but it wasn't so bad. Seems really sturdy and well put together. Only complaint is that this had a warning for "contains products known to California to be cancerous" on the leg. I chose this item over a comparable product because the other product listed the warning in their description and this one did not. Seems a little unfair to the maker I did not choose and I paid more for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Setting it up was a bit off, the instructions said I needed an allen wrench when i really needed a socket wrench. Besides that not too bad, it holds all the weights I own with room for a few more
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easily assembled
customer_reviews.text: Very well made plate rack. Sturdy, easily assembled. Capacity 300lbs. Looks to be accurate. Includes Cup holder or use center hole for barbell storage.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G

customer_reviews.title: Fair but not good
customer_reviews.text: The rack is really flimsy and after putting the weight on it, it seems like will fall apart. Looks are deceiving because there are a lot of poles to hold weight but you definitely can't exceed 300lb of the tree or it might actually bend and or fall apart. Not to mention that putting it together a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works to hold all of my plates. Can’t complain. Sturdy too. Wish it could b on a pivot and spin. That would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble, and doesn't take up a whole lot of room. Just make sure you tighten the bolts very well, especially on the bottom to keep the tree from shifting a bit. The cup holder on top is an excellent addition for a water bottle while you are working out. Good quality and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great value, some stands not offering as much storage ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value, some stands not offering as much storage capacity go for over 100 dollars at Dicks sporting goods, sturdy, great for keeping the plates off the floor
customer_reviews.author: jake goldie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was needing for those old 1 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was needing for those old 1 inch plates that were just laying around. little flimsy but it holds a lot of weight
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Hinjoosa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Weight tree
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weight tree. It's easy to put together and a very solid product. The cup holder is a nice touch but I don't really use it. If you're looking for a big, strong, sturdy tree then get yourself this one. I have two on either side of my power rack; each tree holds: 5x45's,1x35, 1x25, 2x10's, 1x5, 1x2.5 lb plates.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good product that also looks great in my gym!
customer_reviews.text: Quality weight tree that was fairly easy to assemble. No regrets with this purchse.
customer_reviews.author: Sicilianj

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly simple plate tree to assemble, and it doesn't wobble around or feel flimsy when you put it together. It can fit quite a few weights, but the wider ones are impossible to fit. 45KG's have no place on this tree.
customer_reviews.author: L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor directions. Make sure you are handy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor directions. Make sure you are handy! The quality of the product is good though! No complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy quality. I have 4 25lb plates, 4 10 lb plates and 4 5 lb plates and it holds if just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy quality. I have 4 25lb plates, 4 10 lb plates and 4 5 lb plates and it holds if just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapers〘N〙Bots

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to build because of screws
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty difficult to build. I would recommend changing the screws to make them more friendly to build. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: William Mundo

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get.
customer_reviews.text: Good for a small home gym, with limited plates. This is not the "one tower for all your weights" tree
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: but once tightened up was easy. Very stable and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward to put together, but once tightened up was easy. Very stable and heavy duty. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The rack itself feels weak and not sturdy when you put the weight on it but so ...
customer_reviews.text: I got what I paid for. Plate can be organized very conveniently. The rack itself feels weak and not sturdy when you put the weight on it but so far no incidents, it's holding everything on place.
customer_reviews.author: Fino

customer_reviews.title: Seems flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Holds weights ok, just go wild. Figured they would have used a more rigid steel frame.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to organize my husband's weights on our small patio space. Easy to assemble and surprisingly sturdy. Was able to accommodate all his current weights with room to spare. The tower design is perfect for small spaces. Very satisfied - thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Crucian-Rican

customer_reviews.title: Good price, a little Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a bit of a pain to put together and does look a little flimsy when I start stacking my heavy weights on it. Other than that i really like the cup holder in it as I can put my phone or other stuff there. It will hold both Olympic and standard weights. It is definitely a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Torkkola

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent product
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to assemble, but once you get it assembled, it works well. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Squint

customer_reviews.title: Really cleans up my home gym
customer_reviews.text: This thing easily holds my 300 pounds of plates. I have Olympic style, and, like reviewer DirtyWater said, the skinny posts are convenient to use with the wide holes. The cup holder is a just piece of plastic that slips into the upper bracket. I have no need for one, so I left it out and now the hole works perfectly to store my curl bar vertically.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Well Thought Out Design
customer_reviews.text: I really like this weight tree. It has a great deal of storage space yet doesn't take up a lot of space. It even has a place to store any unused barbell. A cup holder is included if you'd prefer to use this feature to hold a water bottle. Once assembled this tree is very sturdy. It is made from thick durable steal and should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Christian McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Holding up my plates well. Total weight is 300 Lbs. I put the larger 45 lbs plates on the two-pronged side and they do not touch the ground or the light-weight plates below them. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Works great! 200lbs of weights in it, and I’m certain it could hold more.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Vreeland

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. I also use the clips it came with for my standard bars so that was an added bonus. The only thing I don't like is that the cup holder should really be a bar holder but then again I knew that before I bought it so it's not really a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: ninjasamuraiwarrior

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not everything lines up nicely when putting it together, and the clamps that go on just barely fit on the pegs. Functional, and still very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: April Choi

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy stand. Easily holds numerous plates. I recommend this product for any home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solidly built. I picked it in part because the racks were welded not bolted. I fill it up with weights and have not had any issues. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: badwhiskey

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of weight on this rig and its holding up nice. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nate the great

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Fits in a corner and all of my weights are organized!
customer_reviews.author: P. Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. Assembled quickly. Holds a decent amount if weight.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: easy put together
customer_reviews.text: Just what I suspected, the instructions as little complicated but you’ll figure it out, easy put together...lol
customer_reviews.author: Chiya C.

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with tools. One of the bolts did not fit the nut. Construction is difficult. My suggestion (because if properly assembled, this rack is quite strong and space saving) is that when tightening the bolts, only tighten them enough to hold it together, then tweak all the pieces so it is level, then tighten the bolts all the way. Otherwise, you'll be like me, tightening/adjusting/untightening/readjusting for 2+ hours. I eventually gave up when the last bolt was too big to fit the nut, I set it aside where it still sits, all misshapen and heavy in the corner of my living room, waiting until I can get the right pieces from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Does what it says. No complaints ... all good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Marcy Plate Tree for Standard Size Weight Plates/Storage Rack for Exercise Weights PT-36
product_meta.description: Forget cluttered gyms and enjoy a neat training area with the PT-36 Weights Rack from Marcy! Managing space in your gym will be as easy as your cool down routine with this ultra-functional weight plates tree. If you’re having trouble keeping all of your lifting plates in one place, then it’s time to get this rack organizer. Whether it’s for your home or a professional gym, the Marcy PT-36 plates tree makes organizing weights a breeze, allowing you to focus on the heavy lifting and not the cleanup! Constructed from high-quality steel, this gym organizer showcases a heavy-duty structure that resists sweat and moisture to help prevent rust buildup over time – guaranteeing that the equipment will be reliable and long-lasting. This storage rack features an ergonomic and compact design with a pyramidal structure to provide enhanced stability, sturdy storage, and easier access. With a maximum weight capacity of 300 pounds, the eight storage rack will hold your weight plates with ease. This Marcy weight plate tree measures 30 x 30 x 32inches. Get the Marcy PT-36 Weights Rack today and free up more space in your gym while you enjoy a comfortable workout!
feature_bullets: HEAVY-DUTY GYM ORGANIZER – Keep all of your weights secured and organized when not in use with this weight storage plate tree. It is resistant to sweat and moisture, which helps prevent rust buildup over time

POWDER-COATED CONSTRUCTION – Reinforced with powder coating, this versatile plate tree boasts a sturdy construction that won’t get tarnished easily, even by the heaviest plate. Its durable surface resists scratches and minimizes scuffs

COMPACT AND SPACE-SAVING DESIGN – Designed with ample storage space, this rack can accommodate standard one-inch plates on each of its eight posts. With its compact form, you can easily place the rack in any corner of the gym

INNOVATIVE TRIANGULAR LAYOUT – Store your plates in a designated space for easy accessibility while keeping things organized! This weight rack has a pyramidal structure that provides enhanced stability, ensuring that it won’t collapse under heavy loads

TWO YEAR MANUFACTURER’S GUARANTEE –Experience intense workout sessions in the comfort of your home without worrying about breaking your equipment! This weight plates storage rack comes with a 2 year manufacturer’s warranty to help maximize your purchase
